sentence.Network_en: I've never heard such a load of tripe in all my life.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一辈子还从没听到过这样一堆废话。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, of unknown origin

entry.def: Tripe is the stomach of a pig, cow, or ox which is eaten as food.
You refer to something that someone has said or written as tripe when you think that it is silly and worthless.

example.ex: I've never heard such a load of tripe in all my life.
example.tran: 我一辈子还从没听到过这样一堆废话。

means.word_mean: 1. lining of the stomach of a ruminant (especially a bovine) used as food
